entries.meaning: Any one of the flat surfaces cut into a gem.
examples: This facet of the diamond was masterfully cut to enhance its value.

entries.meaning: One among many similar or related, yet still distinct things.
examples: The child's learning disability was only one facet of the problems contributing to his delinquency.

entries.meaning: One of a series of things, such as steps in a project.
examples: We had just about completed the research facet of the project when the order came to cancel it.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) One member of a compound eye, as found in insects and crustaceans.

examples: the articular facet of a bone

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Any of the small joints at each segment of the spine that provide stability and help guide motion
(architecture) The narrow plane surface between flutings of a column; a fillet.
(mathematics) A face of codimension 1 of a polytope.
(computing) A criterion that can be used to sort and filter, such as the colour or size of products in an online store.

verbs.description: facet (third-person singular simple present facets, present participle faceting or facetting, simple past and past participle faceted or facetted)

entries.meaning: To cut a facet into a gemstone.
